info.title: Orders API (PII compliant)
info.description: Endpoints that deal with order management. New version of the orders API, created to allow for PII compliance.

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

get.description:
Retrieve order details by searching a specific order ID.

>If you wish to retrieve unmasked data, use the `reason` parameter.

> The `View order` resource is needed to use this API request. This is included in `OMS - Full access` and `IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms`, among other default roles available in the Admin. Learn more about the [License manager roles and resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#).

approvedBy.description: User that approved the order, in case of manual approval.

marketplaceOrderId.description: ID of the order in the marketplace.

marketplaceServicesEndpoint.description: Marketplace endpoint for post purchase communication.

affiliateId.description: Three letter code identifying the marketplace where the order was placed.

statusDescription.description: Status description which is displayed on the Admin panel.

totals.description: Information on each of the order's totals.

items.description: Information on each item in the order.

manualPriceAppliedBy.description: User that applied the manual price, if that is the case.

sellingPrice.description: Selling price in cents. Note that this field may be subject to rounding discrepancies. We recommend retrieving data from the `priceDefinition` data structure instead.

isGift.description: Indicates whether item is a gift.

productCategories.description: Object, where each field is an ID from `productCategoryIds.

{ID}.description: Product category corresponding to the ID in the field key.

sellerChain.description: Sellers involved in the chain. The list should contain only one seller, unless it is a [Multilevel Omnichannel Inventory](https://help.vtex.com/pt/tutorial/multilevel-omnichannel-inventory--7M1xyCZWUyCB7PcjNtOyw4) order.

bundleItems.description: Information on services sold along with the SKU. Example: a gift package.

priceTags.description: Array of price tags, each of which, modifies the price in some way, like discounts or rates that apply to the item in the context of the order.

isPercentual.description: Indicates whether price tag value is applied through a percentage.

items.description: Information on each item in the package.

itemIndex.description: Item index in reference to the position of the item in the `items` array.

type.description: Invoice type `Output` for sales and `Input` for returns.

restitutions.description: Information on how restitutions are to be made to the customer, in case of a return (invoice `type` is `input`).

itemIndex.description: Item index corresponding to the position of the item in the main `items` array.

volumes.description: Quantity of packages involved in the order.

invoiceData.description: Information pertinent to the order's invoice.

orderFormId.description: ID of the shopping cart from which the order was created.

allowCancellation.description: Indicates whether cancelation is allowed for the order.

allowEdition.description: Indicates whether edition is allowed for the order.

isCheckedIn.description: Indicates whether client is checked in.

authorizedDate.description: Date in which the order was authorized in UTC.

invoicedDate.description: Date in which the order was invoiced in UTC.

post.description:
Retrieve a list of orders according to the filters described below.

> This endpoint returns masked order data.

> This should **not** be used for integrations. Use the [orders Feed or hook](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/feed-v3-1) for this purpose.

This endpoint returns only orders that already have been indexed, which takes aproximately four minutes. Because of this, the data retrieved may present inconsistencies. To get live up to date information and [build order integrations](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/erp-integration-set-up-order-integration) use the [orders Feed or hook](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/feed-v3-1).

f_creationDate.description: Concatened value sufix {{creationDate}} and range date in Timestamp format.

page.description: Number of the page to be retrieved.

cancelamento teste shp
Teste de cancelamento do ShopFcil

post.description:
Change the status of an order to indicate that is is in `handling`.

> Expect a `status 204` response with no content in case of a successful request.

> The `Change order workflow status` resource is needed to use this API request. This is included in `OMS - Full access` and `IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms`, among other default roles available in the Admin. Learn more about the [License manager roles and resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#).

You should use this endpoint to cancel an order by its `orderId`.

A common scenario is one where the seller has a problem with the order fulfillment and needs to request the order cancellation to the marketplace. To do this, the seller would need to make this request, passing the `orderId` in the URL.

You should expect a response with the date when the notification was received, the orderId, and a receipt protocol code.

Be aware that if the order status is already `Invoiced`, the order can only be canceled if - before using this request - you send a return invoice through the [Order Invoice Notification endpoint](https://developers.vtex.com/reference/invoice#invoicenotification).

> The `Cancel order` resource is needed to use this API request. This is included in `OMS - Full access` and `IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms`, among other default roles available in the Admin. Learn more about the [License manager roles and resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#).

date.description: Date and time when the notification was received.

orderId.description: Identification of the order in the seller.

receipt.description: Protocol code generated by the update. It may be `null`.

403.description: The credentials are not enabled to access the service.

post.description:
Once the order is invoiced, the seller should use this request to send the invoice information to the marketplace.

We strongly recommend that you always send the object of the invoiced items. With this practice, rounding errors will be avoided.

It is not allowed to use the same `invoiceNumber` in more than one request to the Order Invoice Notification endpoint.

Be aware that this endpoint is also used by the seller to send the order tracking information. This, however, should be done in a separate moment, once the seller has the tracking information.

> The `Notify invoice` resource is needed to use this API request. This is included in `OMS - Full access` and `IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms`, among other default roles available in the Admin. Learn more about the [License manager roles and resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#).

date.description: Date and time when the notification was received.

orderId.description: Identification of the order in the seller.

receipt.description: Protocol code generated by the update. It may be `null`.

post.description:
Send a payment notification of a given order, by order ID and payment ID.

> The `Notify payment` resource is needed to use this API request. This is included in `OMS - Full access` and `IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms`, among other default roles available in the Admin. Learn more about the [License manager roles and resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#).

corporateName.description: Company name, in case client is corporate.

tradeName.description: Company trade name, in case client is corporate.

corporateDocument.description: Company document, in case client is corporate.

stateInscription.description: Company state inscription, in case client is corporate.

corporatePhone.description: Company telephone number, in case client is corporate.

rateAndBenefitsIdentifiers.description: Array with rates and benefits IDs.

logisticsInfo.description: Array with logistics information of each item in the order.

selectedAddresses.description: Array of the selected addresses' information.

itemIndex.description: Item index, matching the index in the `items` array.

slas.description: Array with information on the SLAs.

shipsTo.description: List of countries (three letter ISO code) to which shipping is available.

isPickupStore.description: Indicates whether it is pickup store.

transactions.description: Array with information on each transaction of the order.

payments.description: Array with information on each payment for the order.

referenceValue.description: Reference value for interest calculation in cents.

changesData.description: Array with data on order changes.

itemsAdded.description: Array with information on items added to the order.

itemsRemoved.description: Array with information on items removed from the order.

StartsWithCurrencySymbol.description: Indicates whether value representations start with currency symbol.

list.description: Array containing information on orders listed.

marketPlaceOrderId.description: ID of the order in the marketplace.

affiliateId.description: Three letter code indicating the marketplace in which the order was placed.

origin.description: Indicates whether order is marketplace, fulfillment or chain.

workflowInErrorState.description: Indicates whether order workflow is in error state.

workflowInRetry.description: Indicates whether workflow is in retry.

example.lastMessageUnread: Lux Store 96 Sua Nota Fiscal foi emitida. Referente ao Pedido #v502559llux-01 Ol, J. Estamos empacotando seu produto para providenci

perPage.description: Number of items returned per page.

type.description: The type of invoice. There are two possible values: `"Output"` and `"Input"`. The `"Output"` type should be used when the invoice you are sending is a selling invoice. The `"Input"` type should be used when you send a return invoice.

issuedDate.description: Issuance date of the invoice in ISO format.

invoiceValue.description: Total amount being invoiced in cents. Do not use any decimal separator. For instance, `$24.99` should be represented as `2499`.

extraValue.description: Extra value in the invoice in cents. Do not use any decimal separator. For instance, `$24.99` should be represented as `2499`.

invoiceUrl.description: URL of the invoice. Can be used to send the URL of an XML file, for example, which is useful for some integrations.

courier.description:
The name of the carrier responsible for delivering the order.
> This field should only be used when sending **tracking** information. When the request is used for sending the invoice, this field should be left empty (`""`).

trackingNumber.description:
Code that identifies the order tracking.
> This field should only be used when sending the **tracking** information. When the request is used for sending the invoice, this field should be left empty (`""`).

trackingUrl.description:
URL used to track the order.
> This field should only be used when sending the **tracking** information. When the request is used for sending the invoice, this field should be left empty (`""`).

items.description: Array containing the SKUs that are being invoiced.

volumes.description: Number of volumes in the invoice.

itemIndex.description: Index of the SKU being invoiced.

price.description: Total price of the SKU being invoiced in cents. Do not use any decimal separator. For instance, `$24.99` should be represented as `2499`.

quantity.description: Quantity cof the SKU being invoiced.

Content-Type.name: Content-Type
Content-Type.description: Type of the content being sent.

Accept.name: Accept
Accept.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

f_hasInputInvoice.name: f_hasInputInvoice
f_hasInputInvoice.description: Filters list to return only orders with non `null` values for the `invoiceInput` field.
